alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 11:41AM EST until March 09 at 1:56AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio... Mahoning River At Leavittsburg affecting Trumbull County. For the Mahoning River...including Leavittsburg, Warren, Youngstown...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mahoning River At Leavittsburg. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Several homes in Meadowbrook Drive surrounded by flood waters. Flood waters south of Turner Road. Riverview Drive and Lover`s Lane also inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EST Tuesday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.4 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 04/13/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 945 PM EST.
